intro: Saussurea nipponica var. yoshinagae, commonly known as the Yoshinaga saussurea, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces yellow to orange composite flowers, which are typically arranged in a single head. It thrives in mountainous regions and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
